title: how to grant permission for a specific site
content:
I am getting this message on my desktop from a site that I was using for a few years without any problem. Must to be something in my computer because my roommate in his computer is able to connect to this site. Need help to fix this issue.

"Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site. We can’t connect to the server at unsoloclic.info. If you entered the right address, you can: 

   Try again later    Check your network connection    Check that Firefox has permission to access the web (you might be connected but behind a firewall)"
creator: Jfisdel1

title: Cannot make Mozilla account that is not gmail or apple.
content: I have tried to make a Mozilla account using an outlook mail. Is this not possible? Every single link and Sign In / Sign Up button I have found has redirected me to a page where I can only Sign In to an existing account or continue with Google/Apple. I finally caved and used my Gmail.
creator: nosvar.jacob

title: concerning with Microsoft standard mail
content: Dear Sir or Madam, As you may know, Microsoft's "standard" mail support will end on 12/31/2024. I asked my friend and he said that if I use the Firefox browser, I can still "SEND and RECEIVE" e-mail messages even after the expiration date, so there is NOTHING to worry about. Therefore, I want to confirm that my "friend's opinion" is correct. Please let me know. Sincerely, Yasuo Gima
creator: ygima

title: Secure connection failed
content: Trying to open my doctor's patient portal and I get a "Secure connection failed" Page. So I start Google Chrome and the website comes up like a charm. You people NEED TO GET THIS CR*P FIXED soon. As much as I hate to, I will make Chrome my default browser if this stuff continues for much longer.
